articles.title: Torrevieja Fraudsters' Love Nest Busted: Couple Ran Cybercrime Empire from Flat
articles.author: Staff Reporter
articles.summary: A man, 44, and his 31-year-old partner were running a fraud factory scamming victims across Spain and beyond. They set up a fake website mimicking a telecom company, tricking victims into entering their bank details while trying to top up phone credit. Those stolen details were used to create virtual bank cards, which the fraudsters loaded onto their phones. They used payment cards linked to banks in France, Greece, Cyprus, Lithuania, and Poland. At least 30 victims have been identified in provinces from Madrid to Seville, Valencia, and Zaragoza. The total damage is around €20,000.

articles.title: Auditing the Triple Bottom Line: Blockchain's Role in Ending Child Labour and Protecting the Planet
articles.author: Created by
articles.summary: Abdul is a ten-year-old boy who works in an informal mine in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) to support his family financially. The DRC supplies about 70% of the world's cobalt, an important mineral for rechargeable car batteries.
